Type.Description:
Provisioning content format, optional values as follows:
text, json, xml, yaml, text/html, properties

DataId.Description:
The ID of the configuration. Allowed characters are upper and lower case letters, numbers, decimal points (.), Colons (:), asterisks (*), underscores (_), and underscores (-). When the ID prefix is the following value, ACM will automatically use KMS service to encrypt this configuration:
The prefix is cipher-: the KMS service is called to encrypt and decrypt the configuration. The size of the encrypted data does not exceed 4 KB, and the maximum does not exceed 6 KB. Special symbols such as and (&) will decrypt errors and are not recommended.
The prefix is cipher-kms-aes-128-: using KMS's envelope encryption and decryption method, the configuration content can exceed  6 KB, up to 100 KB. The plain text data of the configuration content will not be transmitted to the KMS system, which is more secure and recommended.

Tags.Description: Label configurations, such as the presence of a plurality of tags, separated by commas

Name.Description: Namespace name
The name of the trail to be created, which must be unique for an account.

SlsProjectArn.Description: The unique ARN of the Log Service project.

RoleName.Description: The RAM role in ActionTrail permitted by the user.

EventRW.Description: Indicates whether the event is a read or a write event. Valid values: Read, Write, and All. Default value: Write.

OssKeyPrefix.Description: The prefix of the specified OSS bucket name. This parameter can be left empty.

OssBucketName.Description: The OSS bucket to which the trail delivers logs. Ensure that this is an existing OSS bucket.

SlsWriteRoleArn.Description: The unique ARN of the Log Service role.

Name.Description: The name of the trail to be created, which must be unique for an account.

StartLoggingTime.Description: The most recent date and time when the user enables the trail.

LatestDeliveryError.Description: The last time an error occurred when the trail attempted to deliver log files.

StopLoggingTime.Description: The most recent date and time when the user disables the trail.

LatestDeliveryTime.Description: The date and time of the last successful delivery of a log file.

IsLogging.Description: Indicates whether the trail is logging API invocations.

Enable.Description: Whether to enable the trail logging.

Name.Description: The name of the trail to be enabled.

ContactId.Description: The ID of the alert contact that you created.

Email.Description: The email address of the contact.

DingRobotWebhookUrl.Description: The DingTalk Chatbot address of the contact.

PhoneNum.Description: The phone number of the contact.

RegionId.Description: Region ID. Default to region of stack.

SystemNoc.Description: Specifies whether to receive system alerts.

ContactName.Description: The name of the alert contact that you want to create.

ContactGroupId.Description: The ID of the alert contact group that you created.

ContactGroupName.Description: The name of the alert contact group that you want to create.

RegionId.Description: Region ID. Default to region of stack.

ContactIds.Description: The list of alert contact ID.

AppId.Description: The ID of the application for which you created the browser monitoring job.

RetcodeAppType.Description: The type of the application for which you want to create the browser monitoring job. Allowed values: web, weex, mini_dd, mini_alipay, mini_wx, mini_common.

RetcodeAppName.Description: The name of the application for which you want to create the browser monitoring job.

RegionId.Description: Region ID. Allowed values: cn-hangzhou, ap-southeast-1. Default to cn-hangzhou.

ServiceMeshId.Description: The ID of the ASM instance.

EnableAudit.Description:
Specifies whether to enable the mesh audit feature. To enable this feature, make sure
that you have activated Alibaba Cloud Log Service.
Valid values: true and false. Default value: false.

OPARequestCPU.Description: The number of CPU cores requested by the OPA container.

OpenAgentPolicy.Description:
Specifies whether to enable the Open Policy Agent (OPA) plug-in.
Valid values: true and false. Default value: false.

OPALogLevel.Description: The log level of the OPA container.

OPALimitCPU.Description: The limit on the CPU of the OPA container.

OPALimitMemory.Description: The limit on the memory size of the OPA container.

OPARequestMemory.Description: The size of the memory requested by the OPA container.

IstioVersion.Description: The Istio version of the ASM instance.

ApiServerPublicEip.Description:
Specifies whether to expose the API server to the Internet.
Valid values: true and false. Default value: false.
If you do not set this parameter, the API server of clusters added to the ASM instance
cannot be accessed from the Internet.

LocalityLoadBalancing.Description:
Specifies whether to route traffic to the nearest instance.
Valid values: true and false. Default value: false.

Telemetry.Description: Specifies whether to enable Prometheus monitoring. We recommend that you use Application Real-Time Monitoring Service (ARMS).

OutboundTrafficPolicy.Description: The outbound traffic policy of the ASM instance.

AuditProject.Description:
The name of the Log Service project that is used for mesh audit.
Default value: mesh-log-{meshId}.

Name.Description: The name of the ASM instance.

ClusterDomain.Description: The domain name of the cluster.

ProxyLimitCPU.Description: The limit on the CPU of the sidecar.

ProxyLimitMemory.Description: The limit on the memory size of the sidecar.

ProxyRequestCPU.Description: The number of CPU cores requested by the sidecar.

ProxyRequestMemory.Description: The size of the memory requested by the sidecar.

VpcId.Description: The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC).

PilotPublicEip.Description:
Specifies whether to expose Istio Pilot to the Internet.
Valid values: true and false. Default value: false.
If you do not set this parameter, only clusters in the same VPC as the ASM instance
can access Istio Pilot of the instance.

IncludeIPRanges.Description:
The Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block in the ASM instance that are denied
to access external services.

VSwitches.Description: The ID of the vSwitch, eg: ["vsw-xzegf5dndkbf4m6eg****"]

Tracing.Description:
Specifies whether to enable the tracing feature. To enable this feature, make sure
that you have activated Alibaba Cloud Tracing Analysis.
Valid values: true and false. Default value: false.

CustomizedZipkin.Description: Specifies whether to use a user-created Zipkin system.

RequestMode.Description: API request mode. "MAPPING" or "PASSTHROUGH". Default is "MAPPING".

RequestProtocol.Description: The protocol of the request, "HTTP", "HTTPS", or "HTTP,HTTPS", Default is "HTTP".

RequestHttpMethod.Description: The HTTP method of the request. Default is GET.

BodyFormat.Description: Describe how data transform to the server, "FORM" for k-v and "STREAM" for bit stream.BodyFormat is required if RequestMode is specified as MAPPING and RequestHttpMethod is POST/PUT/PATCH.

Description.Description: Description of the API, less than 180 characters.

DisableInternet.Description:
Set DisableInternet to true, only support intranet to call API. 
Set DisableInternet to false, then the call is not restricted.

ApiName.Description: The name of the API.Need [4, 50] Chinese\English\Number characters or "_",and should start with Chinese/English character.

ForceNonceCheck.Description:
Set ForceNonceCheck to true, compulsorily check X-Ca-Nonce when requesting, 
this is the unique identifier of the request, generally using UUID to identify. 
The API gateway will verify the validity of this parameter after receiving this parameter. 
The same value can only be used once within 15 minutes. It can effectively prevent API replay attacks.
Set ForceNonceCheck to false, then no check.

ResultType.Description: The format of service's response, "JSON", "TEXT", "BINARY", "XML", "HTML" or "PASSTHROUGH". Default is "JSON".

FailResultSample.Description: The sample of the fail result.

Description.Description: Description of the ERROR, less than 180 characters.

ServiceParametersMap.Description: The mapping relation between (request parameters\const parameters\system parameters) and service parameters.

RequestParameterName.Description: The corresponding request parameter, system parameter or const parameter.

RegularExpression.Description: The regular expression of the parameter when it is String.

Description.Description: Description of the API, less than 180 characters.

JsonScheme.Description: The json scheme of the parameter when it is String.

ApiParameterName.Description: The name of the request parameter.

EnumValue.Description: Allowed parameter value, split with ',' like "1,2,3,4"

MinLength.Description: The min length of the parameter when it is String.

MaxValue.Description: The max value of the parameter when it is Int, Long, Float or Double.

MaxLength.Description: The max length of the parameter when it is String.

DemoValue.Description: The demo value of the request parameter.

DefaultValue.Description: The default value of the request parameter.

MinValue.Description: The min value of the parameter when it is Int, Long, Float or Double.

Location.Description: The location of the reqest parameter.

AppCodeAuthType.Description:
When AuthType is APP authentication, the optional values are as follows: If not passed, the default value is DEFAULT:
DEFAULT: Default (set by group).
DISABLE: Not allowed
HEADER: Allow AppCode header authentication
HEADER_QUERY: Allow AppCode header and query authentication

ServiceAddress.Description: Backend service call address. If the complete backend service address is http://api.a.com:8080/object/add?key1=value1&key2=value2, ServiceAddress corresponds to http://api.a.com:8080.

FunctionComputeConfig.Description: The configuration of the function compute. FunctionComputeConfig is required if ServiceFunctionComputeEnable is TRUE.

Path.Description: The backend request path must contain the Parameter Path in the backend service parameter within brackets ([]). For example: /getUserInfo/[userId].

FunctionName.Description: The function name of function compute.

ContentTypeValue.Description: ContentTypeValue is required if ContentTypeCatagory is DEFAULT or CUSTOM.

ServiceName.Description: The service name of function compute.

FcType.Description:
Function type. Default: FCEvent.
Valid values: FCEvent, HttpTrigger.

OnlyBusinessPath.Description: If set true. The path in the trigger path (for example, /2016-08-15/proxy/xxx/xxx) will not be passed to the backend, and the backend will only receive the customized backend request path.

Method.Description: The HTTP method of the function. Default is GET.

FcRegionId.Description: The region id of function compute.

ContentTypeCatagory.Description: Specify how to determine ContentType header when using function. "DEFAULT" to use API Gateway's default value. "CUSTOM" to use self defined value. "CLIENT" to use client's ContentType header. Default is CLIENT.

RoleArn.Description: Ram authorizes the arn of the API gateway access function compute.

FcBaseUrl.Description: Trigger path. Starts with http:// or https://

MockResult.Description: The returned value when using Mock model.

ContentTypeValue.Description: ContentTypeValue is required if ContentTypeCatagory is DEFAULT or CUSTOM.

VpcConfig.Description: The configuration of the VPC. VpcConfig is required if ServiceVpcEnable is TRUE.

VpcId.Description: The id of the VPC.

Port.Description: The port of the VPC.

ServiceVpcEnable.Description: Whether to use VPC. "TRUE" or "FALSE". Default is FALSE.

MockStatusCode.Description: Status code, returned in the format compatible with HTTP 1.1 response status code and its status

MockHeaders.Description: Custom Mock response header related information when Mock is enabled.

ServiceHttpMethod.Description: The HTTP method to the service. Default is GET.

ServicePath.Description: Backend service call path. If the complete backend service address is http://api.a.com:8080/object/add?key1=value1&key2=value2, ServicePath corresponds to /object/add.

Mock.Description: Whether to use Mock model. "TRUE" or "FALSE". Default is FALSE.

ServiceProtocol.Description: Backend service protocol type, which must be HTTP, HTTPS or FunctionCompute currently.

ContentTypeCatagory.Description: Specify how to determine ContentType header when using service. "DEFAULT" to use API Gateway's default value. "CUSTOM" to use self defined value. "CLIENT" to use client's ContentType header. Default is CLIENT.

Zone to which the instance belongs. For example: cn-beijing-MAZ2(f,g).
Pleas call DescribeZones to get supported zone list.

PricingCycle.Description: Unit of the payment cycle. It could be Month (default) or Year.

AutoPay.Description: Indicates whether automatic payment is enabled. Valid values:false: Automatic payment is disabled. You need to go to Orders to make the payment once an order is generated. true: Automatic payment is enabled. The payment is automatically made.

PluginName.Description: The name of the plug-in that you want to create. It can contain uppercase English letters, lowercase English letters, Chinese characters, numbers, and underscores (). It must be 4 to 50 characters in length and cannot start with an underscore ().

Valid values: ipControl: indicates IP address-based access control. trafficControl: indicates throttling. backendSignature: indicates backend signature. jwtAuth: indicates JWT (OpenId Connect). cors: indicates cross-origin resource access (CORS). caching: indicates caching.

Valid values: ipControl: indicates IP address-based access control. trafficControl: indicates throttling. backendSignature: indicates backend signature. jwtAuth: indicates JWT (OpenId Connect). cors: indicates cross-origin resource access (CORS). caching: indicates caching.

RELEASE: indicates the release environment.
PRE: indicates the pre-release environment.
TEST: indicates the test environment.

CancelOnDelete.Description: Cancel order where delete the resource. Ignore the paid order. Default true

WaitForOrderProduced.Description:
Wait util all orders related ROS resources are produced. 
Support ALIYUN::ECS::PrepayInstance, ALIYUN::RDS::PrepayDBInstance, ALIYUN::REDIS::PrepayInstance, ALIYUN::SLB::LoadBalancer, ALIYUN::VPC::EIP, ALIYUN::VPC::VpnGateway.

SourceIp.Description: Specifies the source IP address of the request.

Lang.Description: Specifies the language type for requesting and receiving messages.

Cert.Description: Specify the content of the certificate. To use the PEM encoding format.

Key.Description: Specify the certificate private key content. To use the PEM encoding format.

Name.Description: Custom certificate name. The certificate name under a user cannot be duplicated.

DomainName.Description: The CDN domain name. Wildcard domain names that start with periods (.) are supported. For example, .a.com.

Cname.Description: The CNAME generated for the CDN domain.You must add a CNAME record with your DNS provider to map the CDN domain name to the CNAME.

ResourceGroupId.Description: The ID of the resource group. If this is left blank, the system automatically fills in the ID of the default resource group.

Scope.Description: Valid values: domestic, overseas, and global. Default value: domestic. The setting is supported for users outside mainland China, users in mainland China of level 3 or above.

DomainName.Description: The CDN domain name. Wildcard domain names that start with periods (.) are supported. For example, .a.com.

CdnType.Description: The business type. Valid values: web, download, video, livestream, and httpsdelivery. web: acceleration of images and small files download. download: acceleration of large file downloads. video: live streaming acceleration. httpsdelivery: SSL acceleration for HTTPS.

TopLevelDomain.Description: The top-level domain, which can only be configured by users on the whitelist.

Tags.Description: Tags to attach to instance. Max support 20 tags to add during create instance. Each tag with two properties Key and Value, and Key is required.

Functions.Description: function list, please refer to the CDN documentation for details.

DomainNames.Description: Your accelerated domain name, separated by commas in English.

OppositeRegionId.Description: The ID of the other interconnected region.

CenId.Description: The ID of the CEN instance.

BandwidthLimit.Description: The bandwidth configured for the interconnected regions communication. Minimal value: 1

LocalRegionId.Description: The ID of the local region.

CenBandwidthPackageId.Description: The ID of the bandwidth package.

Description.Description:
The description of the bandwidth package.
The description can contain [2,256] characters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens, and the name must start with English letters, but cannot start with http:// or https://.

BandwidthPackageChargeType.Description: The billing method. Valid value: PREPAY, POSTPAY (Default)

GeographicRegionBId.Description:
The other area B to connect.
Valid value: China | North-America | Asia-Pacific | Europe | Australia

GeographicRegionAId.Description:
The other area A to connect.
Valid value: China | North-America | Asia-Pacific | Europe | Australia

AutoRenew.Description: Indicates whether automatic renewal is enabled. Valid values:true: Automatic renewal is enabled.false: Automatic renewal is not enabled. You must renew the instance manually.Default value: false.

Bandwidth.Description: The bandwidth in Mbps of the bandwidth package. The bandwidth cannot be less than 2 Mbps.

Period.Description: The purchase period. The default value is 1.

AutoPay.Description:
Whether to automatically pay the bill. Valid value:
true
false (Default)

AutoRenewDuration.Description: Duration of each automatic renewals. It takes effect when AutoRenew is true.

Name.Description:
The name of the bandwidth package.
The name can contain 2-128 characters including a-z, A-Z, 0-9, periods, underlines, and hyphens. It must start with English letters, but cannot start with http:// or https://.

CenId.Description: The ID of the CEN instance.

CenBandwidthPackageId.Description: The ID of the bandwidth package.

ProtectionLevel.Description:
The level of CIDR block overlapping. 
Set the value to REDUCED. REDUCED indicates that the 
CIDR blocks can overlap with each other but must not be the same.

Description.Description:
The description of the instance.
The name can be 2-256 characters in length. It can start with an uppercase letter, lowercase letter, or Chinese character. It can contain numbers, underscores (_), and hyphens (-), but cannot start with http:// or https://.

Tags.Description: Tags to attach to instance. Max support 20 tags to add during create instance. Each tag with two properties Key and Value, and Key is required.

Name.Description:
The name of the instance.
The name can be 2-128 characters in length. It can start with an uppercase letter, lowercase letter, or Chinese character. It can contain numbers, underscores (_), and hyphens (-), but cannot start with http:// or https://.

ChildInstanceType.Description: The type of the network to attach. Support VPC, VBR or CCN.

CenId.Description: The ID of the CEN instance.

ChildInstanceOwnerId.Description: The account ID to which the network belongs.

ChildInstanceId.Description: The ID of the network to attach.

ChildInstanceRegionId.Description: The ID of the region where the network is located. The ID of the region where the network is located.

RouteMapId.Description: The ID of the route map.

Description.Description: The description of the route map.

SourceInstanceIdsReverseMatch.Description:
The IDs of source instances to be advertised do not support match statements. Valid values: 
 false (default value): If the source instance ID is in the SourceInstanceIds field, the match is successful. 
 true: If the source instance ID is not in the SourceInstanceIds field, the match is successful.

TransmitDirection.Description:
The direction in which the route map is applied. Valid values: 
 RegionIn: Routes are advertised to CEN gateways. 
 For example, routes are advertised from network instances deployed in the current region or other regions to the gateways deployed in the current region. 
 RegionOut: Routes are advertised from CEN gateways. 
 For example, routes are advertised from gateways deployed in the current region to network instances or gateways deployed in other regions.

MatchCommunitySet.Description:
Match statements are used to match the Communities. Enter each Community in the format of nn:nn. Valid values of nn: 1 to 65535. You can enter at most 32 Communities. Each Community must comply with RFC 1997. RFC 8092 is not supported. 
 Note If the configurations of the Communities are incorrect, routes may not be advertised to the on-premises data center.

*.Description:
Match statements are used to match the Communities. Enter each Community in the format of nn:nn. Valid values of nn: 1 to 65535. You can enter at most 32 Communities. Each Community must comply with RFC 1997. RFC 8092 is not supported. 
 Note If the configurations of the Communities are incorrect, routes may not be advertised to the on-premises data center.

CenRegionId.Description: The region where the CEN instance is deployed. You can call the DescribeRegions operation to query region IDs.

SourceRouteTableIds.Description: Match statements are used to match source route table IDs of the routes. You can enter at most 32 route table IDs.

*.Description: Match statements are used to match source route table IDs of the routes. You can enter at most 32 route table IDs.

DestinationInstanceIds.Description:
Match statements are used to match the destination instance IDs. 
 You can enter instance IDs of the following types: VPC, VBR, CCN in mainland China, and SAG. You can enter at most 32 instance IDs. 
 Note The destination instance IDs are valid only when the route map is applied to scenarios where routes are advertised from gateways in the current region to instances in the current region.

*.Description:
Match statements are used to match the destination instance IDs. 
 You can enter instance IDs of the following types: VPC, VBR, CCN in mainland China, and SAG. You can enter at most 32 instance IDs. 
 Note The destination instance IDs are valid only when the route map is applied to scenarios where routes are advertised from gateways in the current region to instances in the current region.

DestinationInstanceIdsReverseMatch.Description:
The IDs of destination instances to be advertised do not support match statements. Valid values: 
 false(default value): If the ID of the destination instance to be advertised is in the DestinationInstanceIds field, the match is successful. 
 true: If the ID of the destination instance to be advertised is not in the DestinationInstanceIds filed, the match is successful.

SourceInstanceIds.Description:
Match statements are used to match source instance IDs of the routes. 
 You can enter instance IDs of the following types: virtual private cloud (VPC), virtual border router (VBR), Cloud Connect Network (CCN) in mainland China, Smart Access Gateway (SAG). You can enter at most 32 instance IDs.

*.Description:
Match statements are used to match source instance IDs of the routes. 
 You can enter instance IDs of the following types: virtual private cloud (VPC), virtual border router (VBR), Cloud Connect Network (CCN) in mainland China, Smart Access Gateway (SAG). You can enter at most 32 instance IDs.

DestinationRouteTableIds.Description:
Match statements are used to match the IDs of the destination route tables. You can enter at most 32 route table IDs. 
 Note The destination route table IDs are valid only when the route map is applied to scenarios where routes are advertised from gateways in the current region to route tables in the current region.

*.Description:
Match statements are used to match the IDs of the destination route tables. You can enter at most 32 route table IDs. 
 Note The destination route table IDs are valid only when the route map is applied to scenarios where routes are advertised from gateways in the current region to route tables in the current region.

DestinationCidrBlocks.Description: Match statements are used to match the routing prefixes. The CIDR format is used. You can enter at most 32 CIDR blocks.

*.Description: Match statements are used to match the routing prefixes. The CIDR format is used. You can enter at most 32 CIDR blocks.

OperateCommunitySet.Description:
Action statements are used to operate the Communities. Valid values: Enter each Community in the format of nn:nn. Valid values of nn: 1 to 65535. You can enter at most 32 Communities. Each Community must comply with RFC 1997. RFC 8092 is not supported. 
 Note If the configurations of the Communities are incorrect, routes may not be advertised to the on-premises data center.

*.Description:
Action statements are used to operate the Communities. Valid values: Enter each Community in the format of nn:nn. Valid values of nn: 1 to 65535. You can enter at most 32 Communities. Each Community must comply with RFC 1997. RFC 8092 is not supported. 
 Note If the configurations of the Communities are incorrect, routes may not be advertised to the on-premises data center.

DestinationChildInstanceTypes.Description:
Match statements are used to match the destination instance types. Valid values: 
 VPC: VPCs. 
 VBR: VBRs. 
 CCN: CCN instances in mainland China. 
 Note The destination instance types are valid only when the route map is applied to scenarios where routes are advertised from gateways in the current region to instances in the current region.

*.Description:
Match statements are used to match the destination instance types. Valid values: 
 VPC: VPCs. 
 VBR: VBRs. 
 CCN: CCN instances in mainland China. 
 Note The destination instance types are valid only when the route map is applied to scenarios where routes are advertised from gateways in the current region to instances in the current region.

Priority.Description:
The priority of the route map. Valid values: 1 to 100 . A lower value indicates a higher priority. 
 Note In the same region, for route maps that are applied in the same direction, the priority is unique. When a route map is implemented, the system matches conditions with a route map whose priority number is the smallest. Therefore, make sure that you set priorities for route maps to meet your requirements.

SourceChildInstanceTypes.Description:
Match statements are used to match source instance types of the routes. Valid values: 
 VPC: VPCs. 
 VBR: VBRs. 
 CCN: CCN instances in mainland China.

*.Description:
Match statements are used to match source instance types of the routes. Valid values: 
 VPC: VPCs. 
 VBR: VBRs. 
 CCN: CCN instances in mainland China.

AsPathMatchMode.Description:
Match statements are used to match the AS paths. Valid values:
 Include: uses fuzzy match. If the AS path in the condition overlaps with the AS path in the route, the match is successful.
 Complete: uses exact match. Only when the AS path in the condition is the same as the AS path in the route, the match is successful.

CidrMatchMode.Description:
Match statements are used to match the prefixes. Valid values: 
 Include: uses fuzzy match. If the routing prefix in the condition contains the routing prefix of the route, the match is successful. 
 For example, the 1.1.0.0/16 policy can match the 1.1.1.0/24 route. 
 Complete: uses exact match. Only when the routing prefix in the condition is the same as the routing prefix of the route, the match is successful. 
 For example, the 1.1.0.0/16 policy can match the 1.1.0.0/16 route.

MapResult.Description:
The route map behavior after all conditions are matched. Valid values: 
 Permit: allows the routes that are matched. 
 Deny: rejects the routes that are matched.

RouteTypes.Description:
Match statements are used to match the route types. Valid values: 
 System: system routes that are generated by the system. 
 Custom: custom routes that are created by users. 
 BGP: Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) routes that are advertised to BGP. 
 You can enter multiple types.

*.Description:
Match statements are used to match the route types. Valid values: 
 System: system routes that are generated by the system. 
 Custom: custom routes that are created by users. 
 BGP: Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) routes that are advertised to BGP. 
 You can enter multiple types.

Preference.Description: Action statements are used to modify route priorities. Valid values: 1 to 100. Default value: 50. A smaller number indicates a higher priority.

CommunityOperateMode.Description:
Action statements are used to operate the Communities. Valid values: 
 Additive: adds. 
 Replace: replaces.

CenId.Description: The ID of the Cloud Enterprise Network (CEN) instance.

NextPriority.Description:
The priority of the next associated route map. Valid values: 1 to 100. 
 If the priority is not set, no next route map is associated with the current route map. 
 If the priority is set to 1, the next route map is associated with the current route map. 
 If the priority is set and the value is not 1, the priority of the associated route map must be higher than that of the current route map. 
 Only when the MapResult parameter is set to Permit, the matched routes continue to match the next associated route maps.

PrependAsPath.Description:
AS paths are attached when regional gateways receive or advertise routes. 
 For route maps that are applied in different directions, the requirements for AS paths to be attached are different: 
 For the inbound direction: You must specify the list of source instance IDs and the source region in the condition to be matched. The source region must be the same as the region where the route map is applied. 
 For the outbound direction: You must specify the list of destination instance IDs in the condition to be matched.

*.Description:
AS paths are attached when regional gateways receive or advertise routes. 
 For route maps that are applied in different directions, the requirements for AS paths to be attached are different: 
 For the inbound direction: You must specify the list of source instance IDs and the source region in the condition to be matched. The source region must be the same as the region where the route map is applied. 
 For the outbound direction: You must specify the list of destination instance IDs in the condition to be matched.

CommunityMatchMode.Description:
Match statements are used to match the Communities. Valid values: 
 Include: uses fuzzy match. If the Community in the condition overlaps with the Community of the route, the match is successful. 
 Complete: uses exact match. Only when the Community in the condition is the same as the Community of the route, the match is successful.

MatchAsns.Description:
Match statements are used to match AS paths of the routes. An AS path is a mandatory attribute, which describes the AS number through which a BGP route passes when the BGP route is advertised. 
 Only the AS-SEQUENCE parameter is supported. The AS-SET, AS-CONFED-SEQUENCE, and AS-CONFED-SET parameters are not supported. Specifically, only the AS number list is supported. Sets and sub-lists are not supported.

*.Description:
Match statements are used to match AS paths of the routes. An AS path is a mandatory attribute, which describes the AS number through which a BGP route passes when the BGP route is advertised. 
 Only the AS-SEQUENCE parameter is supported. The AS-SET, AS-CONFED-SEQUENCE, and AS-CONFED-SET parameters are not supported. Specifically, only the AS number list is supported. Sets and sub-lists are not supported.

SourceRegionIds.Description: Match statements are used to match source region IDs of the routes. You can enter at most 32 region IDs.

*.Description: Match statements are used to match source region IDs of the routes. You can enter at most 32 region IDs.

HealthCheckSourceIp.Description: You can use either of the following methods to specify the source IP address of the health check.  Automatic IP Address: The system automatically assigns an IP address within the CIDR block 100.96.0.0/16 (recommended).  Custom IP Address: You can specify a source IP address that is available within the CIDR block 10.0.0.0/8, 192.168.0.0/16, or 172.16.0.0/12. The specified source IP address must not overlap with the IP addresses of the Alibaba Cloud-facing and client-facing interfaces on the VBR instance, or the IP addresses of the instances with which the VBR instance needs to communicate in the CEN.

HealthyThreshold.Description: Specifies the number of probe packets to be sent during the health check.  Default value: 8. Valid values: 3 to 8.  Unit: packet.

HealthCheckTargetIp.Description: Specifies the destination IP address of the health check. The destination IP address is the IP address of the client-facing interface on the VBR instance.

When DestinationType as location, Destination area for the purpose (see below position encoding specific regions). For example: [ "BJ11", "ZB"]

If the DestinationType parameter is set to group, set the value to the name of an address book.

If the DestinationType parameter is set to domain, set the value to a domain name.

MQ_TOPIC (Message Service topic)
OCS (old version ApsaraDB for Memcache)
OPENSEARCH (Open Search)
OSS (Object Storage Service)
POLARDB (ApsaraDB for POLARDB)
PETADATA (HybridDB for MySQL)

SHAREBANDWIDTHPACKAGES (shared bandwidth package)
SLS (Log Service)
VPN (VPN Gateway )

InstanceId.Description: The ID of the resource instance.

RegionId.Description: The ID of the region where the instance is deployed, such as cn-hangzhou.

GroupId.Description: The ID of the application group.

ProcessUser.Description: The user who launched the process.

TaskId.Description: The ID of the site monitoring task.

Address.Description: The URL or IP address monitored by the monitoring task.

OptionsJson.Description:
The extended options of the protocol that is used by the site monitoring task. The
options vary based on the protocol.

TaskName.Description:
The name of the site monitoring task. The name must be 4 to 100 characters in length.
It can contain letters, digits, and underscores (_).

TaskType.Description:
The protocol used by the site monitoring task. Valid values: HTTP, HTTPS, PING, TCP,
UDP, DNS, SMTP, POP3, and FTP.

IspCities.Description:
The information about detection points, which is specified in a JSON array. Example:
[{"city":"546","isp":"465"},{"city":"572","isp":"465"},{"city":"738","isp":"465"}]. The three city codes represent Beijing, Hangzhou, and Qingdao.
Note You can call the DescribeSiteMonitorISPCityList API operation to query the detection
points that can be used to create site monitoring tasks. For more information, see
DescribeSiteMonitorISPCityList . If this parameter is not specified, the system randomly selects three detection
points for site monitoring.

Interval.Description:
The interval at which detection requests are sent. Valid values: 1, 5, and 15. Unit:
minutes. Default value: 1.

*.Description:
The ID of the alert rule. The ID of an existing alert rule to be associated with the
site monitoring task. You can call the DescribeMetricRuleList API operation to query
the IDs of existing alert rules. For more information, see DescribeMetricRuleList.

Entry.Description: The IP address range that is allowed to access the instance.
The IP address range that is allowed to access the instance.

ModuleName.Description:
The name of the module in the instance for which a whitelist is configured. Valid
values: Registry and Chart.

RegionId.Description: Region ID of instance. Default is current region.

DefaultVisibility.Description: repository default visibility, public or private

RepoNamespace.Description: the namespace the repo belongs to

SourceRepoType.Description:
code source type. Allow values: 
CODE, GITHUB, GITLAB, BITBUCKET. Enterprise Edition additional support CODEUP and GITEE

IsDisableCache.Description: Whether to disable Cache at build time

TaskId.Description: Task ID. Automatically assigned by the system, the user queries the task status.
Task ID. Automatically assigned by the system, the user queries the task status.

true: which means that the public network API Server is open.
false: If set to false, the API server on the public network will not be created, only the API server on the private network will be created.Default to false.

Network plug-in: including Flannel and Terway network plug-ins

cloud_ssd: SSD cloud disk
Default to cloud_efficiency.

NodePortRange.Description:
Node service port. The value range is [30000, 65535].
Default to 30000-65535.

WorkerSystemDiskSize.Description:

Default to 120.

false: not open

MasterVSwitchIds.Description: Master node switch ID. To ensure high availability of the cluster, it is recommended that you select 3 switches and distribute them in different Availability Zones.

Name.Description: The name of the cluster. The cluster name can use uppercase and lowercase letters, Chinese characters, numbers, and dashes.

Taint.Description: It is used to mark nodes with taints. It is usually used for the scheduling strategy of Pods. The corresponding concept is: tolerance. If there is a corresponding tolerance mark on the Pods, the stain on the node can be tolerated and scheduled to the node.

Data disk type. Value includes:
cloud: ordinary cloud disk
cloud_efficiency: efficient cloud disk
cloud_ssd: SSD cloud disk

Whether to install the cloud monitoring plugin:
true: indicates installation
false: Do not install
Default to false

ServiceCidr.Description: The service network segment cannot conflict with the VPC network segment and the container network segment. When the system is selected to automatically create a VPC, the network segment 172.19.0.0/20 is used by default.

PodVswitchIds.Description:
The list of pod vSwitches. For each vSwitch that is allocated to nodes, 
 you must specify at least one pod vSwitch in the same zone. 
 The pod vSwitches cannot be the same as the node vSwitches. 
 We recommend that you set the mask length of the CIDR block to a value no 
greater than 19 for the pod vSwitches.
The pod_vswitch_ids parameter is required when the Terway network 
plug-in is selected for the cluster.

WorkerAutoRenew.Description:
Whether to enable automatic renewal of Worker nodes. The optional values are:
true: automatic renewal
false: do not renew automatically
Default to true.

ProxyMode.Description: kube-proxy proxy mode, supports both iptables and ipvs modes. The default is iptables.

true: indicates that it fails to roll back

Description

DeliveryChannelId.Description: The ID of the delivery method.

Description.Description: The description of the delivery method.

DeliveryChannelName.Description: The name of the delivery method.

DeliveryChannelTargetArn.Description:
The ARN of the delivery destination. This parameter is required when you create a
delivery method. The value must be in one of the following formats:
acs:oss:{RegionId}:{Aliuid}:{bucketName} if your delivery destination is an Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket.
acs:mns:{RegionId}:{Aliuid}:/topics/{topicName} if your delivery destination is a Message Service (MNS) topic.
acs:log:{RegionId}:{Aliuid}:project/{projectName}/logstore/{logstoreName} if your delivery destination is a Log Service Logstore.

DeliveryChannelAssumeRoleArn.Description:
The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the role to be assumed by the delivery method.
This parameter is required when you create a delivery method.
Note If the delivery method assumes the service linked role for Cloud Config, you can specify
the ARN in the format of the provided example and replace the account ID with the
ID of your Alibaba Cloud account.

DeliveryChannelType.Description:
The type of the delivery method. This parameter is required when you create a delivery
method. Valid values:
OSS
MNS
SLS

DeliveryChannelCondition.Description:
The rule attached to the delivery method. This parameter is applicable only to delivery
methods of the MNS type.
This parameter allows you to specify the lowest risk level for the events to subscribe
to and the resource types for which you want to subscribe to events.
To specify the lowest risk level for the events to subscribe to, use the following
format:{"filterType":"RuleRiskLevel","value":"1","multiple":false}.
The value field indicates the lowest risk level and can be set to 1, 2, or 3, which
indicates the high risk level, the medium risk level, and the low risk level, respectively.
To specify the resource types for which you want to subscribe to events, use the following
format:{"filterType":"ResourceType","values":["ACS::ACK::Cluster","ACS::ActionTrail::Trail","ACS::CBWP::CommonBandwidthPackage"],"multiple":true}.
The values field indicates the resource types. Its value is a JSON array.
Example: [{"filterType":"ResourceType","values":["ACS::ActionTrail::Trail","ACS::CBWP::CommonBandwidthPackage","ACS::CDN::Domain","ACS::CEN::CenBandwidthPackage","ACS::CEN::CenInstance","ACS::CEN::Flowlog","ACS::DdosCoo::Instance"],"multiple":true}]

TagKeyScope.Description: The rule monitors the tag key, only applies to rules created based on managed rules

TagValueScope.Description: The rule monitors the tag value, only applies to rules created based on managed rules

Description.Description: The description of the rule

ExcludeResourceIdsScope.Description: The rule monitors excluded resource IDs, multiple of which are separated by commas, only applies to rules created based on managed rules, , custom rule this field is empty

SourceOwner.Description: Specifies whether you or Alibaba Cloud owns and manages the rule. Valid values:  CUSTOM_FC: The rule is a custom rule and you own the rule. ALIYUN: The rule is a managed rule and Alibaba Cloud owns the rule

SourceIdentifier.Description: The identifier of the rule.  For a managed rule, the value is the name of the managed rule. For a custom rule, the value is the ARN of the custom rule

MaximumExecutionFrequency.Description: The frequency of the compliance evaluations. Valid values:  One_Hour Three_Hours Six_Hours Twelve_Hours TwentyFour_Hours

EventSource.Description: The event source of the rule.

RegionIdsScope.Description: The rule monitors region IDs, separated by commas, only applies to rules created based on managed rules

ConfigRuleTriggerTypes.Description: The trigger type of the rule. Valid values:  ConfigurationItemChangeNotification: The rule is triggered upon configuration changes. ScheduledNotification: The rule is triggered as scheduled.

ProjectName.Description: The name of the project. Length [3, 32]. Beginning with characters, only characters, numbers and _ are allowed.

StartTask.Description: Start restore task after creating a recovery task.

DuplicateConflict.Description:
The handling method for conflicts between objects with the same name. Valid values:
failure: The object with the same name fails (default).
renamenew: renames an object with the same name.

DestinationEndpointPassword.Description:
The password that is used to log on to the RDS instance.
Note You must specify this parameter when the database type is Redis, or the database location
is agent and the database type is MSSQL.

DestinationEndpointIP.Description:
The endpoint used to connect to the database.
NoteDestinationEndpointInstanceType is express, agent, or other. This parameter is required.

DestinationEndpointPort.Description:
The port that is used to access the database of the primary MySQL server.
NoteDestinationEndpointInstanceType is in the format of express, agent, other, or ECS. This parameter is required.

DestinationEndpointOracleSID.Description:
The SID of the Oracle instance.
Note This parameter is required if the database type is Oracle.

BackupSetId.Description:
The ID of the full backup set used for restoration, which is mutually exclusive to
RestoreTime.

DestinationEndpointInstanceType.Description:
The location of the database. Valid values: 
- rds 
- ecs 
- express: a database connected over express connect, VPN Gateway, or smart gateway. 
- agent: The database connected through the backup Gateway 
- dds: apsaradb for MongoDB 
- kvstore 
- polardb 
- drds 
- dg: the database is directly connected through IP Address: Port.

RestoreTime.Description: The time when the fault is restored. Set the value to 1554560477000.

DestinationEndpointRegion.Description:
The region of the database.
NoteDestinationEndpointInstanceType for RDS, ECS, DDS, Express, or Agent, this parameter is required.

DestinationEndpointDatabaseName.Description:
The name of the RDS database.
Note When the database type is PostgreSQL or MongoDB, this parameter is required.

DestinationEndpointUserName.Description:
The database account.
Note You must specify this parameter when the database type is Redis, or the database location
is agent and the database type is MSSQL.

RestoreObjects.Description:
Restore an object.
Note For details, see the following RestoreObjects if the database is located in an agent, this parameter is required in other scenarios.

RestoreTaskName.Description: The name of the restoration task.

BackupPlanId.Description: The ID of the backup plan.

BackupGatewayId.Description:
The ID of the backup gateway.
NoteDestinationEndpointInstanceType if you set this parameter to agent, this parameter is required.

DestinationEndpointInstanceID.Description:
The ID of the ApsaraDB RDS instance to query.
NoteDestinationEndpointInstanceType if the value is RDS, ECS, DDS, or Express, this parameter is required.

InstanceId.Description: The ID of the database instance.

Port.Description: The connection port of the database instance.

Host.Description: The endpoint of the database instance.

InstanceSource.Description:
The source of the database instance. Valid values:
PUBLIC_OWN: an on-premises database built on the public network.
RDS: an ApsaraDB for RDS (RDS) instance.
ECS_OWN: an on-premises database built on an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.
VPC_IDC: an on-premises database built in an Internet data center (IDC) in Virtual Private
Cloud (VPC).

DatabasePassword.Description: The logon password of the database instance.

Port.Description: The connection port of the database instance.

Host.Description: The endpoint of the database instance.

ExportTimeout.Description: The timeout period for exporting the database instance. Unit: seconds.

SafeRule.Description:
The security rule of the database instance. Enter the name of the security rule for
your enterprise.
Note To query a specified security rule, log on to the DMS Enterprise console and choose
System Management > Security Rules. The security rule appears in the security rule
list.

DdlOnline.Description:
[Important] Specifies whether to enable the online data description language (DDL)
service. Currently, this service is available only for the MySQL and PolarDB databases.
0: The service is disabled.
1: The native online DDL service prevails.
2: Data change without table locking provided by DMS prevails.

EnvType.Description:
The type of the environment to which the database instance belongs. Valid values:
product: the production environment.
dev: the test environment.

Tid.Description:
The ID of the tenant.
Note To query the ID, log on to the DMS Enterprise console and choose System Management
> Instance Management or System Management > User Management. The ID of the tenant
appears in the Service Specification section.

UseDsql.Description:
Specifies whether to enable cross-database query for the database instance. Valid
values:
0: disabled
1: enabled

Sid.Description:
The system ID (SID) of the database instance.
Note You must specify this parameter if the InstanceType parameter is set to PostgreSQL or Oracle.

EcsInstanceId.Description:
The ID of the ECS instance to which the database instance belongs.
Note You must specify this parameter if the InstanceSource parameter is set to ECS_OWN.

VpcId.Description:
The ID of the VPC to which the database instance belongs.
Note You must specify this parameter if the InstanceSource parameter is set to VPC_IDC.

InstanceAlias.Description:
The alias of the database instance. The alias helps you quickly find the required
instance.

DbaUid.Description:
The Alibaba Cloud unique ID (UID) of the database administrator (DBA) of the database
instance.
Note To query the UID, log on to the DMS Enterprise console and choose System Management
> User Management.

EcsRegion.Description:
The region where the database instance resides.
Note You must specify this parameter if the InstanceSource parameter is set to ECS_OWN or VPC_IDC.

NetworkType.Description:
The network type of the database instance. Valid values:
CLASSIC
VPC

DatabaseUser.Description: The logon username of the database instance.

InstanceType.Description: The type of the database instance. Valid values: MySQL, SQLServer, PostgreSQL, Oracle, DRDS, OceanBase, Mongo, Redis

DataLinkName.Description: The name of the data link for cross-database query.

QueryTimeout.Description: The timeout period for querying the database instance. Unit: seconds.

GroupName.Description: The name of the domain name group

PunyCode.Description: punycode returned only for a Chinese domain name

DnsServers.Description: The DNS list for the domain name under resolution

Tags.Description: Tags to attach to instance. Max support 20 tags to add during create instance. Each tag with two properties Key and Value, and Key is required.

GroupId.Description: Domain name grouping, the default is the "default grouping" GroupId

RecordId.Description: Parse the ID of the record

RR.Description: Host record, if you want to resolve @.exmaple.com, the host record should fill in "@" instead of empty

Line.Description: Parse the line, the default is default. See parsing line enumeration

Type.Description: Parse record type, see parsing record type format

Priority.Description: The priority of the MX record, the value range [1,10], when the record type is MX record, this parameter must be

TTL.Description: The resolution time is valid. The default is 600 seconds (10 minutes). See the TTL definition.

DbInstType.Description:
The type of the attached storage. Valid values:
RDS or POLARDB

Type.Description:
Database Sharding method. For more information, see scalability principle. Valid values:
HORIZONTAL: indicates HORIZONTAL partitioning, which is commonly known as database
and table sharding.
VERTICAL: indicates VERTICAL partitioning.

RdsInstance.Description: This property is required only for vertical partitioning.

DbInstanceIsCreating.Description: Check whether the RDS instance is being created.

ShardDbName.Description: List of databases that need to be split vertically in the RDS instance.This property is only used in vertical subdivision.

DbInstanceId.Description: List of DB instance ID that requires vertical segmentation.This property is only used in vertical subdivision.

AccountName.Description: In the vertical split scenario, an account name with access rights to the corresponding database on all RDSs.

Password.Description: The logon password of the database instance.

Description.Description: Description of the DRDS instance, 2-128 characters

ZoneId.Description: Availability zone, an available zone belongs to a certain zone, such as Hangzhou Availability Zone A (cn-hangzhou-a) belongs to the region Hangzhou (cn-hangzhou)

PricingCycle.Description: The unit of the order period, year: year, month: month. The parameter takes effect when the payment type is drdsPre.

InstanceSeries.Description: drds.sn1.4c8g Starter Edition; drds.sn1.8c16g Standard Edition; drds.sn1.16c32g Business Edition; drds.sn1.32c64g Ultimate Edition

Specification.Description: The example specification, for example, drds.sn1.4c8g.8C16G, consists of the DRDS instance series (drds.sn1.4c8g) plus a specific example specification (8C16G). For the DRDS instance specification value range, see: Distributed Relational Database Service Specifications and Pricing

Duration.Description: The number of cycles ordered. When PricingCycle=year, the value is 1-3; when PricingCycle=month, the value is 1-9. The parameter takes effect when the payment type is drdsPre.

PayType.Description: For the type of payment, see "Payment Type Parameter Table"

VswitchId.Description: Virtual switch ID, must be specified when creating a DRDS for VPC network type

Type.Description: Instance type, instance type 0 - shared instance 1 - exclusive instance, in addition, this parameter can also pass PRIVATE and PUBLIC to represent exclusive instance and shared instance respectively

MySQLVersion.Description: The MySQL protocol version supported by DRDS. Valid values: 5 and 8. Default value: 5. This parameter is valid only when the primary instance is created. The read-only instance is the same as the primary instance by default.

VpcId.Description: Virtual private network ID, must be specified when creating a DRDS for VPC network type

IsAutoRenew.Description: Whether to renew the fee automatically, if it is purchased on a monthly basis, it will automatically renew for one month, and if it is purchased on an annual basis, it will automatically renew for one year. The parameter takes effect when the payment type is drdsPre.

Tags.Description: Tags to attach to instance. Max support 20 tags to add during create instance. Each tag with two properties Key and Value, and Key is required.

MigrationObject.Description: Objects that need to be migrated

ColumnName.Description: Column names are not migrated in the table to be migrated

NewColumnName.Description: The name of the column to be migrated to be mapped in the target instance

ColumnName.Description: The column name to be migrated in the table to be migrated

NewTableName.Description: The name of the table to be migrated in the target instance mapping

TableName.Description: The name of the table to be migrated does not require the table name of the migration table.

NewSchemaName.Description: Schema name to be migrated by Schema in the target instance

NewDBName.Description: The name of the db to be migrated in the target instance.

Role.Description: When the source instance is an RDS instance and the source instance is different from the Alibaba Cloud account to which the target instance belongs, this parameter is the authorization role of the Alibaba Cloud account to which the source instance belongs to the target instance Alibaba Cloud account. For details on the permissions and authorization methods required for this role, see Cross-Account Migration Synchronization.

InstanceID.Description:
Target instance ID
When the DestinationEndpoint.InstanceType value is RDS, this parameter needs to be passed to the RDS instance ID.
When the DestinationEndpoint.InstanceType value is ECS, this parameter needs to be passed to the ECS instance ID.
When the DestinationEndpoint.InstanceType value is MongoDB, this parameter needs to be passed to the MongoDB instance ID.
When the DestinationEndpoint.InstanceType value is Redis, this parameter needs to be passed in the Redis instance ID.
When the DestinationEndpoint.InstanceType value is DRDS, this parameter needs to be passed to the DRDS instance ID.
When the DestinationEndpoint.InstanceType value is PetaData, this parameter needs to pass in the PetaData instance ID.
When the DestinationEndpoint.InstanceType value is OceanBase, this parameter needs to be passed to the OceanBase instance ID.
When the DestinationEndpoint.InstanceType value is POLARDB, this parameter needs to be passed to the POLARDB for MySQL cluster ID.

IP.Description: The connection address of the target instance. Required when the source instance is a self-built database.

Port.Description: The listening port of the target instance, which is required when the source instance is a self-built database.

DatabaseName.Description: The connection database library name of the target instance, which is required if the target instance's database type is: PostgreSQL, PPAS, or MongoDB

Region.Description: The area where the target instance is located. If it is a self-built database, you can select the area closest to the physical distance of the self-built IDC.

InstanceType.Description:
The instance type of the target instance, including:
RDS: Alibaba Cloud RDS instance
ECS: Self-built database on ECS
LocalInstance: Self-built database of local IDC
MongoDB: Alibaba Cloud MongoDB instance
Redis: Alibaba Cloud Redis instance
DRDS: Alibaba Cloud DRDS instance
PetaData: Alibaba Cloud PetaData instance
OceanBase: Alibaba Cloud OceanBase instance
POLARDB: Alibaba Cloud POLARDB for MySQL Cluster

EngineName.Description:
The data type of the target instance. It is required when the target instance is a self-built database. The values include:
MySQL, SQLServer, PostgreSQL, PPAS, MongoDB, Redis

Password.Description: Target instance password

MigrationJobClass.Description:
Migrating instance specifications, which can be:
small, medium, large and so on.
Various specifications of the reference data migration test performance specifications

Role.Description: When the source instance is an RDS instance and the source instance is different from the Alibaba Cloud account to which the target instance belongs, this parameter is the authorization role of the Alibaba Cloud account to which the source instance belongs to the target instance Alibaba Cloud account. For details on the permissions and authorization methods required for this role, see Cross-Account Migration Synchronization.

OracleSID.Description: When the source instance database type is Oracle, this parameter is Oracle SID

OwnerID.Description: When the source instance is an RDS instance and the source instance is different from the Alibaba Cloud account to which the target instance belongs, this parameter is the UID of the Alibaba Cloud account to which the source RDS instance belongs.

InstanceID.Description:
Source instance ID.
When the value of SourceEndpoint.InstanceType is RDS, this parameter needs to be passed in the RDS instance ID.
When the SourceEndpoint.InstanceType value is ECS, this parameter needs to be passed to the ECS instance ID.
When the SourceEndpoint.InstanceType value is Express, this parameter needs to be passed in the VPC ID (ie, the proprietary network ID).
When the SourceEndpoint.InstanceType value is MongoDB, this parameter needs to be passed to the MongoDB instance ID.
When the SourceEndpoint.InstanceType value is POLARDB, this parameter needs to be passed to POLARDB for MySQL cluster ID.

IP.Description: The connection address of the source instance. Required when the source instance is a self-built database.

Port.Description: The listening port of the source instance, which is required when the source instance is a self-built database.

DatabaseName.Description: When the source instance database type is PostgreSQL or MongoDB, this parameter is the database library name used when creating the connection.

Region.Description: The area where the source instance is located. If it is a self-built database, you can select the area closest to the physical distance of the self-built IDC.

InstanceType.Description:
The instance type of the migration source instance, including:
RDS: Alibaba Cloud RDS instance
ECS: Self-built database on ECS
LocalInstance: Self-built database with public IP address
Express: self-built database accessed via dedicated line
MongoDB: Ali cloud MongoDB instance
POLARDB: Alibaba Cloud POLARDB for MySQL Cluster

EngineName.Description:
The database type of the source instance, which is required when SourceEndpoint.InstanceType is not RDS. Values include:
MySQL, SQLServer, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MongoDB, Redis

Password.Description: Source instance password

StructureIntialization.Description:
Whether the migration task performs structural migration, and the values include:
true: indicates that a structure migration is required.
false: indicates no structural migration

DataSynchronization.Description:
Whether the migration task synchronizes incremental data, including:
true: Indicates that incremental data synchronization is required.
false: Indicates that incremental data synchronization is not performed.

DataIntialization.Description:
Whether the migration task performs full data migration, and the values include:
true: indicates that full data migration is required.
false: indicates no structural migration

SubscriptionInstanceId.Description: The ID of Data subscription instance.

SubscriptionObject.Description: Objects that need to be migrated.

TableName.Description: Table name not to be subscribed.

DML.Description: Whether to subscribe to DML type data.

DDL.Description: Whether to subscribe to DDL type data.

Role.Description: When the source instance is an RDS instance and the source instance is different from the Alibaba Cloud account to which the target instance belongs, this parameter is the authorization role of the Alibaba Cloud account to which the source instance belongs to the target instance Alibaba Cloud account.

OracleSID.Description: When the source instance database type is Oracle, this parameter is Oracle SID

OwnerID.Description: When the source instance is an RDS instance and the source instance is different from the Alibaba Cloud account to which the target instance belongs, this parameter is the UID of the Alibaba Cloud account to which the source RDS instance belongs.

InstanceID.Description:
Source instance ID.
When the value of SourceEndpoint.InstanceType is RDS, this parameter needs to be passed in the RDS instance ID.
When the SourceEndpoint.InstanceType value is ECS, this parameter needs to be passed to the ECS instance ID.

IP.Description: The connection address of the source instance. Required when the source instance is a self-built database.

Port.Description: The listening port of the source instance, which is required when the source instance is a self-built database.

DatabaseName.Description: The database library name used when creating the connection.

InstanceType.Description:
The instance type of the subscription source instance, including:
RDS: Alibaba Cloud RDS instance
ECS: Self-built database on ECS

Password.Description: Source instance password

SourceEndpointInstanceType.Description: Data subscription instance type, value is: MySQL, PolarDB, DRDS, Oracle. Default: MySQL.

SynchronizationObjects.Description: Objects that need to be synchronized

ColumnName.Description: Column names are not synchronized in the table to be synchronized

NewColumnName.Description: The name of the column to be synchronized to be mapped in the target instance

NewTableName.Description: The name of the table to be synchronized in the target instance mapping

TableName.Description: The name of the table to be synchronized does not require the table name of the migration table.

NewSchemaName.Description: Schema name to be synchronized by Schema in the target instance

NewDBName.Description: The name of the db to be synchronized in the target instance.

Period.Description:
If prepaid payment type, then the parameters specified in the purchase package instance or instances as examples of a monthly subscription, which can be:
Year: Annual, Month: monthly

PayType.Description:
Payment type, which include:
Postpaid: postpaid type, Prepaid: Prepaid type. Default is Postpaid

Topology.Description: Synchronous topology, the value includes: oneway, bidirectional.the default value is: oneway, only MySQL-> MySQL synchronization, this parameter can receive the value bidirectional

SourceRegion.Description: Region where the synchronization source instance is located.

DataInitialization.Description:
Whether to perform full data initialization before synchronization. The values include:true: means full data initialization
false: no full data initialization
The default value is: true

IP.Description: The connection address of the target instance. Required if the target instance is a local DB accessed through a dedicated line.

Port.Description: Listening port of the target instance. Required when the target instance is ECS or a local DB accessed through a dedicated line.

InstanceType.Description:
The instance type of the synchronization target instance for configuration, including:
Redis: Alibaba Cloud Redis instance
RDS: Alibaba Cloud RDS instance
POLARDB: Alibaba Cloud POLARDB for MySQL Cluster
ECS: Self-built database on ECS
Express: self-built database accessed via dedicated line
MaxCompute: Alibaba Cloud MaxCompute instance
DataHub: Alibaba Cloud DataHub instance
AnalyticDB: Alibaba Cloud Analytic Database MySQL Version (2.0)
AnalyticDB30: Alibaba Cloud Analytic Database MySQL Version (3.0)
Greenplum: Cloud-native data warehouse ADB PostgreSQL version (formerly analytical database PostgreSQL version).
The default value is RDS

InstanceTypeForCreation.Description:
The instance type of the synchronization target instance for creation, including:
MySQL: Alibaba Cloud MySQL instance
PolarDB: Alibaba Cloud POLARDB for MySQL Cluster
MaxCompute: Alibaba Cloud MaxCompute instance.
If this property is not specified, it will be same with InstanceType

Password.Description: Target instance password

NetworkType.Description: When synchronization geographies, the type of data transmission network used. Value include: Internet, Intranet. The default value is: Internet

Role.Description: When the synchronization source instance and the target instance do not belong to the same Alibaba Cloud account, this parameter is the authorized role of the account to which the source instance belongs to the Alibaba Cloud account to which the target instance belongs, and the relevant permissions and authorization steps of the reference.

OwnerID.Description: When the source instance and the target instance do not belong to the same Alibaba Cloud account, this parameter is the UID of the Alibaba Cloud account to which the source instance belongs.

IP.Description: The connection address of the source instance. Required if the source instance is a local DB accessed through a dedicated line.

Port.Description: Listening port of the source instance. Required when the source instance is ECS or a local DB accessed through a dedicated line.

InstanceType.Description:
The instance type of the synchronization source instance for configuration, including:
Redis: Alibaba Cloud Redis instance
RDS: Alibaba Cloud RDS instance

dg: Self-built database accessed via the database gateway DG
cen: Self-built database accessed via the cloud enterprise network CEN.

Password.Description: Source instance password

UsedTime.Description: f the payment type is prepaid, then this parameter is the length of the purchase, and parameters such as 1, 2, 3 can be passed in as needed

StructureInitialization.Description:
Whether to initialize the structure object before synchronization. The values include:true: indicates that the structure object is initialized
false: no result object initialization
The default value is: true

SynchronizationJobClass.Description:
Synchronous instance specifications, which can be:
micro, small, medium, large and so on. The default value is: small

VSwitchId.Description: The ID of the VSwitch. Currently, ECI instances can only be deployed in VPCs.

RegionId.Description: The ID of the region in which the instance resides.

ECI Sysctl is valid for every container in ECI.
Currently only two Sysctl keyNames are supported:
Kernel.shm_rmid_forced
Kernel.msgmax

InitContainer.Description: The containers that constitute the container group for initializing.

WorkingDir.Description: The working directory for the container.

ImagePullPolicy.Description: The image pull policy. You can use it to pull the image from the image repository.

Command.Description: The list of commands that you want to send to a container to run. You can specify a maximum of 1 commands. Maximum length per string: 256 characters.

Memory.Description: The memory assigned to the container. Unit: GiB.

Arg.Description: The arguments passed to the commands. A maximum of 10 arguments are supported.

Port.Description: The open ports and protocols. You can set a maximum of 100 ports.

Protocol.Description: The protocol that the port uses. Valid values: TCP and UDP

Cpu.Description: The number of vCPUs assigned to the container. Unit: vCPUs (cores).

VolumeMount.Description: The number of volumes that are mounted to the container. A maximum of 16 volumes are supported.

MountPath.Description: A mount path. The data in the target directory is overwritten by the data in the mounted volume. Therefore, use caution when you mount a volume to a directory.

Name.Description: The name of the volume. The name is the same as that specified for the Name parameter in the Volume section.

EnvironmentVar.Description: Environment variables in the operating system of the container. Each environment variable is a key/value pair, and both the key and value are strings. A maximum of 100 environment variables are supported. The key indicates the name of a variable. The value indicates the value of the variable.

FieldRef.FieldPath.Description: A reference to another variable. Currently, only status.podIP is supported.

Value.Description: The value of the variable. The value must be [0,256] characters in length.

Key.Description: The name of the variable. The name must be [1,128] characters in length and can contain [, 0-9a-zA-Z, ], and underscores (_). It cannot start with a digit.

Name.Description: The name of the container.

ContainerGroupName.Description:
The name of the container group. 
The length is [2,128] English lowercase letters, numbers or hyphens (-), cannot begin or end with a hyphens.

Container.Description: The containers that constitute the container group.

InitialDelaySeconds.Description: The number of seconds after the container has started before probes are initiated.

Exec.Command.Description: The commands for running the readiness probe.

SuccessThreshold.Description: The minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Default value: 1.

InstanceType.Description: The type of the ECS instance.

SpotStrategy.Description:
Instance preemption strategy.
Ranges:
NoSpot (default): normal pay-as-you-go instances.
SpotWithPriceLimit: Preemptive instance that sets a cap price.
SpotAsPriceGo: The system automatically bids, following the current market actual price.
